intro: Neja subvillosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are softly pubescent, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue to purple in color, blooming in the morning. Neja subvillosa is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species with similar climbing habits.
